findings.title: Reentrancy vulnerability in withdraw function
findings.explanation: The contract calls an external address (msg.sender.call.value) before updating the user balance, allowing an attacker to re-enter the withdraw function and drain funds repeatedly before their balance is decremented.
findings.fix_suggestion: Follow the checks-effects-interactions pattern: update the user's balance before making any external calls, and use `transfer` or a reentrancy guard to limit gas forwarded for safer external calls.
